project.name: jspec
project.description: JSON-based specification format for rapid AI agent context retrieval. Provides jspec-template as a starter template for projects.

architecture.philosophy: Provide AI agents with structured, queryable context to eliminate codebase exploration overhead

conventions.versioning: Semantic versioning for the spec format itself

decisions.title: Use single JSON file as source of truth
decisions.context: AI agents waste time exploring codebases. Need fast, precise context retrieval.
decisions.decision: Use single .jspec/source.json file with structured data, queryable via jq
decisions.consequences: Agents get instant context. Must maintain spec alongside code. JSON parsing overhead minimal.

decisions.title: Use object for specs instead of array
decisions.context: Need to avoid duplicate keys and enable direct access
decisions.decision: Use object with unique keys for specs: {"spec-name": {...}}
decisions.consequences: Direct access via jq '.specs["name"]'. Natural key uniqueness. Slightly more verbose queries for filtering.

jspec-format.description: The jspec format itself - structure and conventions

project.name: string - project name
project.conventions: object - global coding and organizational conventions

specs.description: object - keyed by unique spec identifier

spec_schema.type: string - spec type (api, model, component, etc.)
any additional fields relevant to the spec

jspec-cli.description: Bash CLI tool for managing .jspec/source.json files

commands.add-spec: Add a new spec with ID, type, description, and tags
commands.update-spec: Update a field in an existing spec
commands.get: Get a specific spec by ID

jspec-cli.purpose: Provide a human-friendly CLI interface for creating and managing jspec files without manual JSON editing

jspec-depth-system.description: Single unified agent architecture where jspec-worker handles all operations from high-level management to detailed implementation
jspec-depth-system.purpose: Simplified architecture with one agent that can handle any jspec task

spec_levels.simple: Single file, small component, or focused investigation
spec_levels.medium: Module, service, or feature with multiple files
spec_levels.complex: System, architecture, or large-scale feature spanning multiple modules

concepts.unified_approach: Single agent handles both management operations (add/update/validate specs) and implementation work (read/implement/verify specs)

agent_responsibilities.jspec-worker: Handles ALL operations: extends specs, validates structure, analyzes codebase, implements features, explains specs, and verifies implementations

jspec-worker.description: Unified agent for managing and implementing jspec specifications - handles both high-level management operations and detailed implementation work
jspec-worker.purpose: Single agent that can extend, validate, maintain jspec files AND read/implement individual specs

management: Analyze specs and provide recommendations (analyze command)
implementation: Read and explain spec details (explain command)
Implement specs according to requirements (implement command)

commands.extend: Add a new spec to the jspec file
commands.validate: Validate the jspec structure and check for inconsistencies
commands.analyze: Analyze the current jspec structure and provide recommendations
commands.suggest-specs: Suggest missing specs based on codebase analysis
commands.sync: Ensure jspec is in sync with actual codebase structure
commands.test-sync: Verify that all specs have corresponding implementations
commands.implement: Implement a spec according to its requirements
commands.explain: Read and explain a specific spec's details
commands.verify: Verify if a spec is implemented correctly

jspec-worker.reading_policy: MANDATORY: Always use jspec-cli tool for reading specs. Use '.jspec/cli/jspec.sh get <spec-id>' instead of jq queries. This ensures consistent access patterns and proper tool usage.

jspec-internal-tests.description: Folder containing small test programs to validate jspec capabilities and workflows
jspec-internal-tests.purpose: Sandbox for experimenting with jspec workflows, agent capabilities, and spec-driven development

requirements: Display game board after each move
